=== About Me ===
Enthusiastic Ubuntu advocate. Retired from career in technical design and systems roles in defence industry and water utilities. Set up and ran Age Concern Berkshire Computer Centre for novice users. Resigned from this Windows-only activity after three years when I had discovered Freedom!

{{http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll248/candtalan/sized1-1.jpg}}

=== Contributions ===

Run a Ubuntu-centric FOSS display table (non trading) at ongoing monthly Computer Fairs, Bracknell, with leaflets and CDs. 
Support Ubuntu and FOSS exhibition stands, eg London Olympia, including custom Ubuntu leaflets.
Ran a table at Wallingford festival (Bunkfest 2009, 3 days).
Give talks and Ubuntu demonstrations to computer clubs.
Am a volunteer sysadmin for a local charity which now has 6 Ubuntu computers.
Contribute to various forums, including Novatech (Linux) and Age Concern Discussions (Computers and Internet). The latter is most notably an uphill advocacy task.
Actively support a number of friends and family with Ubuntu. 
And Not least: am proud  :-) to have suggested the T Shirt text "I do it with Ubuntu"

=== Future Goals ===

Maintain ongoing existing roles and activities. 
Proposed addition of Hour Ubuntu in Bracknell.
